Augment Layer¶

class sknet.layer.RandomCrop(incoming, crop_size, training=None)[source]¶

Random cropping of input images

During training, a random continuous part of the image of shape crop_size is extracted and used as layer output. During testing, the center part of the image of shape crop_size is used as output.

Parameters:
  • incoming (tuple of positive int or Layer instance) – The input to the layer
  • crop_size – Shape of the image after crop

Example of use:

input_layer = Input((64,3,32,32),data_format='NCHW') # Init an input layer with input shape
crop_layer  = RandomCrop(input_layer,(28,28))        # output of this layer is (64,3,28,28)
__init__(incoming, crop_size, training=None)[source]¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.
